required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Observational Study of Renal Cell Cancer Patients Treated With Nivolumab Plus Ipilimumab in the Real World Setting in Japan
clinical_study.official_title: Japanese Prospective Real World Registry of Nivolumab Plus Ipilimumab in Subjects With Previously Untreated, Advanced or Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (ARCC) Categorized Into IMDC Intermediate/Poor Risks (J-ENCORE)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational, descriptive study of renal cell cancer patients who are treated with the combination of nivolumab plus ipilimumab as first line of systematic therapy in the real world setting in Japan.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of starting nivolumab plus ipilimumab to the date of death from any cause. (Up to 3 years)

From date of starting nivolumab plus ipilimumab to the first date of documented progression, as determined by the investigators (as per RECIST 1.1 criteria), or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. (Up to 3 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in tumor response over time

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first documentation of tumor response after the date of starting nivolumab plus ipilimumab to disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. (Up to 3 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: The quality of life by National Comprehensive Cancer Network/ Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)-Kidney Symptom Index 19 (NCCN-FACT FKSI-19) v2.0
Number of participants with Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the observation period or until 100 days after discontinuation of dosing with nivolumab and ipilimumab (Up to 3 years)
From initiation of a second line of therapy after discontinuation of first line nivolumab+ipilimumab treatment (Up to 3 years)

clinical_study.condition: Advanced or Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: Patients with previously untreated advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma (RCC) with intermediate or poor International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium (IMDC) risk classification, who will be treated with Nivolumab + Ipilimumab for the first time

study_pop.textblock: The study population includes adult (≧ 20 years) Japanese patients with histological confirmation of advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma (aRCC) and International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium (IMDC) risk category Intermediate/Poor who will be treated with the combination of nivolumab+ipilimumab as first line of systematic therapy in the real world setting.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histological confirmation of Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
- No prior systemic therapy for RCC
- RCC patients who are anticipated to start treatment with nivolumab and ipilimumab regimen in the timeframe between after IRB approval to enrollment-end date
- IMDC risk category Intermediate/Poor
- ≧ 20 years old patients for whom informed consent was obtained from the patient at the time of this study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are enrolled in a post marketing safety study on nivolumab plus ipilimumab combination therapy in Japan
- Pregnant and/or lactating women
- Patients who are judged to be inappropriate by investigator

overall_contact.last_name: Recruiting sites have contact information. Please contact the sites directly. If there is no contact information,

overall_contact_backup.last_name: First line of the email MUST contain NCT # and Site #.
